thread.title: Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs
thread.title_full: Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs

author: BETH HARRIS
title: Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs
text:
Chris Carlson Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs 
Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw watches during batting practice for the National League Division Series that is set to begin on Friday between the Los Angeles Dodgers and the New York Mets, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson) Chris Carlson Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs 
New York Mets starting pitcher Jacob deGrom warms up during workouts in preparation for the National League Division Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers that is set to begin on Friday, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson) Chris Carlson Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs 
New York Mets starting pitcher Jacob deGrom, left, greets third baseman David Wright during batting practice in preparation for the National League Division Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers that is set to begin on Friday, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson) Chris Carlson Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs 
New York Mets manager Terry Collins talks with the media in Los Angeles, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, before workouts in preparation for the National League Division Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers. The series is set to begin on Friday. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson) Chris Carlson Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs 
New York Mets center fielder Yoenis Cespedes poses with his caricature after a workout in preparation for the National League Division Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers that is set to begin on Friday, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson) Chris Carlson Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs 
Los Angeles Dodgers right fielder Yasiel Puig throws during workouts for the National League Division Series between the Los Angeles Dodgers and the New York Mets that is set to begin on Friday, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson) Chris Carlson Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs 
Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly watches during batting practice in preparation for the National League Division Series that is set to begin on Friday against the New York Mets, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson) Chris Carlson Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs 
Los Angeles Dodgers manager Don Mattingly watches during batting practice in preparation for the National League Division Series against the New York Mets that is set to begin on Friday, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson) Posted: Thursday, October 8, 2015 7:26 pm | Updated: 9:00 pm, Thu Oct 8, 2015. Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs   
LOS ANGELES (AP) â€” Clayton Kershaw isn't sure what to expect from the new-look Mets, whose dramatic transformation in the second half of the season led to an NL East title. 
The Los Angeles Dodgers ace faced a mostly different New York lineup before the July trade deadline.
